result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick J White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence being served
Conditions of extended supervision are the same as those ordered in the imposed probation sentence.
Consecutive to: to extended supervision sentence now being served

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not have contact with any known drug users and shall not be in any place where drugs are used/sold.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample if one has not already been provided.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling, or combination of both.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick J White

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Letter received from Exodus Transitional Care Facility

Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Agreement reached.  Def waives preliminary hearing. Court questions def and accepts waiver.  Court orders State to file Information w/in 48 hrs.  Def enters guilty plea.  Court finds def guilty.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Not possess any controlled substance without valid prescription

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich of State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Jeanette Kara Corbett for State.  Clerk: CP.    Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court questions State re complaint vs probable cause statement re test of substance being "inconclusive".  Court finds probable cause based on complaint.  Def is on ES hold.  Court sets $2000 signature bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.  SPD to represent.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  If counsel wishes to have hearing sooner than 2-25 for purpose of ATR, counsel shall advise and case will be rescheduled.  Hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.
